catalog_info.title: Human Cognition: Reading and Writing the Neural Code
catalog_info.description: In this course, we will explore a new and cutting-edge discipline in neuroscience -- invasive human neurophysiology. Some neurosurgical procedures, such as deep brain stimulation surgery, allow for the unique opportunity to directly access the human brain while patients are awake-and-behaving. Topics will include: place/grid cells, deep brain stimulation, epilepsy, face processing, brain-machine control, and reward processing. Students must complete both terms of this course(parts A and B) within the same academic year in order to receive credit.
